Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient hotel. Rude night manager.”
Reviews.Author: moretravel2Bhad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful. We had a room on the top of this castle of mazes and, yes, did get lost trying to find it again the first night. Thought people would find us asleep in the hallway, we were so lost. I think that added to the excitement of our stay. It is so close to everything and most of the staff were really warm and welcoming. BUT just don't ask the night manager any questions. He was really rude and made us feel like we were really intruding on his evening. Apparently we were not the only ones. Some travelling companions were sharing a similar story. Beautiful hotel. Shame about the rude night manager.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Dede A
Reviews.Content: This hotel really feels like Italy. This is comfortable hotel in the middle of the action. Our room did not have a bidet, though my friends and others did have one in their room. They had a very small shower, too small to shave you legs. There are lots of stairs and some of my friends got lost trying to find their room. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: marie137
Reviews.Content: Four of us travelling together stayed in 2 rooms in the hotel. We had booked almost a year ago through a hotel booking site when we saw it at a good price. The hotel did not disappoint us. It was only a 5 minute walk from the train station with no bridges to cross. The luggage storage system at the hotel was well organised and the staff very helpful providing us with maps od the city. Breakfast was very good. The rooms were large for Europe - although I think we may have had bigger rooms with sofa beds? The noise from outside was audible from the rooms but they were clean and comfortable. Free wifi was also good. Would readily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine - near train station on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: RichJ19
Reviews.Content: Older hotel with an interior that is truly a maze, making it difficult for the older members of our group to get around. The interior rooms are less than desirable, so I highly suggest requesting a room with a view of the Grand Canal. Location is fine....it's Venice so you won't likely spend a lot of time in the room. Bathrooms tiny, even small for European standards. We will stay somewhere else when we return to Venice someday (when the budget is replenished...Yikes, this is an expensive city).

Reviews.Title: “Everything is good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything is good: location, breakfast, service etc However, the room is not sound-proof and next room's activity affects a lot. Also, the bed is not comfortable and looks like it's a used mattress being used.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Gautam D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Could not have done better. A class 3 star hotel for any traveller. Highly recommended. Top marks on all counts - location ,service, cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast too was excellent. Look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Its Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for our purpose. As expected it was old and tired and the rooms smelt a little musty ( expected after all look where you are!) but is was so central only a short walk to almost anywhere you would like to see.

Reviews.Title: “venice”
Reviews.Author: KathleenG20
Reviews.Content: The Continental Hotel Venice is a perfect place to stay, an easy walk from St Lucia station and easy walking to the Rialto Bridge with the markets and shops along the way.Easy to catch the ferry to St Marks Square, rooms spacious, restaurant excellent, staff very helpful, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “just off...”
Reviews.Author: dutchmysteryguest80
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a decent and affordable place close to the train station. If these are your requirements, Continental is okay. We requested a twin room. We were shown to a double room. We immediately asked if there was no twin available, so the porter contacted the reception desk and we were taken to a room meeting our reservation request. Although I am quite sure we would have had kind a a view from this room, I also noticed thick layers of dust on the armatures and the over all impression was very depressing. So we walked the sauna like corridors to arrive to the room we did use during our stay. This room had a more up to date appearance (headboard jugendstil like). The place reminded me of the claustrophobic experience at the Sistine Chapel: no where to flee in case of fire... And indeed the room did not show a map the nearest emergency exits. There were metal bars in front of the windows. The 'view' was the hotel room of other guests 3-4 meters accross an inner court, which itself was filled up with trash, ac units and scaffolds. What else: We did not dare to use the elevator, which reminded us of elevators we have seen in communist countries. The toilets in the lounge are a big insult to paying customers. The hotel bar which the hotel claims to have is in fact out side of the hotel, so a seasonal terrace. The hotel boasts to have an extensive wine list, but in reality they have just a few wines to sell, which are also not very impressive. The lounge is like a waiting area in a train station, but with plush chairs. The breakfast area is lovely, when you are lucky enough to sit in the area near the Canal, but the bigger part of the room is dark, cellar like and uninviting. As high tide was expected one morning break fast was to be served in the room. We are not sure why, because we did not see any water getting into the hotel/break fast area. One night around 5AM an alarm went off. We had no idea if this was a fire alarm or what ever, smelled nothing, saw no one, so were left wondering what was going on. The ac in our room was disconnected (no- not broken!) and the room was very hot. Leaving our windows open was met every single day by the cleaning staff closing it again. Also the shower was disconnected (but there was a bath). During weekdays 8AM builders start working and shouting. We had to check out at noon and left our luggage in the storage. When we came to get it, obviously we were no longer guests of the hotel and we were no longer greeted in a pleasant way by the receptionist. So, if in fact you would like to have a drink at the hotel bar, go to next door hotel Principe. You can also use the toilets there! Right across the street there is a little pizza restaurant, not adding costs for a 'coperto' nor adding 12% service. Consider it as a cafeteria and you will not be disappointed. A bit more in the direction of the train station you will find Brek restaurant. A chain, all over Italy. They have good, honest and affordable food, but this is not the place to be for a special occasion. As mentioned: We were looking for a decent and affordable place close to the train station. Unfortunately the hotel of our 1st choice was fully booked. So we will not book here again, unless we have to.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the continental for one night. The room was small and not particulalrly clean. It was impossible to use the shower without flooding the bathroom. The buffet breakfast was a shambles as they had booked several bus groups in to the hotel at the same time. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: cwhelan136
Reviews.Content: Old, tired, dirty, The shower was disgusting( a rusty metal box,door would not close, shower head would not stay in place). Very, very dirty sheer curtains that gave us no privacy unless the shutters were closed and then had no fresh air and room was dark and depressing. Restaurant is nice having outdoor service on the Grand Canal. The hotel is far removed from St. Mark's and the best parts of venice. It is about an hour walk. There are hundreds of hotel in Venice, you can find one much better and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MLtravelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - easily accessible to railway and airport shuttle bus. As with most Italian hotels the rooms are small but adequate. Breakfast was good and we tool advantage of a 20euro meal offer and it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Dollyfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in May before going on a cruise. Close to the train station which is why we chose it. Our room had 2 opening windows facing the Grand Canal. Was not even expecting that and really appreciated the view. The furnishings were old, but this is an old hotel with a lot of character. The bed and pillows were quite firm but adequate. Bathroom clean and had everything we needed. We had breakfast inside because it was a bit cool and wet for the terrace, but the restaurant was lovely and the continental food was very good. The staff were all pleasant and we liked our stay and would stay there again, but since there are so many hotels in Venice, if we returned we might look at other hotels for variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great end to European adventure”
Reviews.Author: Aly O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for 2 nights and really enjoyed the stay. The rooms were well sized for Venice accom and the bathroom was really clean. Great location close to the station and an easy walk to the main areas and our room window overlooked the Grand Canal! The breakfast was superb, with great variety of food at a good quality. While the price is a little higher than others, I'd definitely recommend Hotel Continental as a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “The Continental in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Maria D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 nights at the end of August, 2011 so in my time there I saw a few staff members who were always very professional and helpful. My room had a view to the canal. This hotel was fine. It was not overly priced for its location and the breakfast on their varandah which was on the canal was truly lovely. It certainly made the daily breakfast (which was quite delicious) an enjoyable start to the day. The front desk staff were very, very helpful and I certainly have no complaints. On my request they organized help for my luggage to St Lucia Station and it certainly was no bother for the hotel staff to do so and the organized help arrived on time.without any fuss. Yes, their service at the hotel was professional and always, always pleasant. Maria (Australia)

Reviews.Title: “Good location - make sure to ask for things”
Reviews.Author: pucktraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the train and bus stations, and we stayed in a single-bed room with a bathroom and had a view of the Grand Canal - if you looked out the window and turned your head to the left. The staff here was not friendly. The food was OK, but dessert was basically a Good Humor-type cup of soft ice cream. Then again, we weren't in Venice for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seemed”
Reviews.Author: michael60
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately based our selection on location (proximity to the train station in Venice). The hotel was indeed close. But the attitude of the front desk staff was dismissive at best. The rooms were small. The beds hard with single pillows. Breakfast was adequate and there was a Hot Water Heater in the room for tea.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no extravagance”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_S_11
Reviews.Content: Location is great â€“ 5 minutes walk from the train station, right in the middle of things, surrounded by that real Venice atmosphere. Room was simple but fine for our family of 4. Two beds and two extra bunks made it a bit crowded, but that is to be expected in an old hotel. There was broken glass on both the bathroom floor and the carpet in the room when we arrived, and I had to ask the staff to clean it up twice before it was properly done. Breakfast is good with a lot of variety, and the breakfast salon is right by the Canal Grande. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable. The Continental was great for our first Venice experience because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Northern Venice Stepping Stone”
Reviews.Author: G4UCY
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and accommodating. We stayed on half board basis and although we had to eat inside the quality of food and service was magnificent. Breakfast was the same but catered for a range of continental & hot breakfast. After the first evening we were given the option to dine outside but we preferred the restaurant to ourselves. Need to mention that all of the waiters are fantastic and gave a really professional and personal service. If your planning on eating here be prepared to spend approx. â‚¬80 to â‚¬100 but as prices go in Venice its worth it. No problems accessing the Wi-Fi as mentioned in previous 'reviews'. Hot water is accessed by pulling string and waiting a minute, no problem. Daily maid service left room tidy even gave us extra pillows without asking. The whole of the hotel is rather spotless and the air-con is welcome after a day in the sun. Remember to close both the shutter and double glazed window, evenings get really noisy. Worst part of the whole stay was the noise from inconsiderate residents made when coming to bed. Overall it's location is near to northern Venice and it's convenient enough to start a days walk into the other areas. Prepare for some walking but that's Venice. Tip 1 Cross over the Ponte de le Guglie pass the supermarket with the ice cream cone bin on the left there is a wine homebrew shop â‚¬2 bottles of Pinot Noir etc. The owner has spare empties with lids. Shop is called Vinaria Nave De Oro, address is Cannaregio 1370 Tip 2 Morning Tour of 8 churches. Begin with S.Geremia, S.Leonardo, S.Marcuola, S.M.Madalena, S.Fosca, S.Marziale, C.Della Misericodia, C.Po de la Madonna de L'Orto. Unfortunately some are not always open best to try from 9:30. Most are free but a donation is acceptable. Women need to cover their shoulders. Tip 3 Really look at what your paying for, espresso range from â‚¬1 to â‚¬2.50. We didn't eat out on an evening but there were plenty of places with set menus from â‚¬18. it's the drinks that are expensive a beer can be â‚¬5 upwards. The cheapest wine in the hotel was â‚¬18 and a large beer was â‚¬7. A bottle of 75cl water is â‚¬4. The Guinness bar is â‚¬5 for a large beer.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Deconuts
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an Insight Tour "Italian Elegance" and our last two nights were spent at this hotel. Location is good, yes it is on the Grand Canal, although not close to the main hub of things, eg St Marks Square etc. Water taxis however are plentiful and at a reasonable cost. Our room was adequate and it did have views of the canal but quite noisy at night. The hotel staff, in my opinion, were very rude, not only to myself but also extremely rude to our Tour Manager. Wait staff were quite disagreeable and surly. We were advised that Venetians in general are rude to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Really a Great Place and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MMarsh888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last June 2011. Very good situated because it is just near the train station. The transportation here in Venice is mostly by boat, and going to other places, one has to walk - a LOT- and trek bridges and stairs. If you have children in trolleys or old people who wants to enjoy Venice, this is the right place to stay. One more plus point for this hotel is that the breakfast area is in a terrace overlooking the Grand Canal......I really enjoyed my stay in Venice and our Continental Hotel experience made it more special .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and wonderful location !!”
Reviews.Author: Toti11_19
Reviews.Content: I totally disagree with the bad reviews concerning the staff of the hotel!! Here is why. My wife and I made a stopover for one night in Venice on our trip from Austria and on to Tuscany. We chose this hotel for its great location on the Grand Canal (a wonderful terrace for breakfast) and close to shopping streets. On the morning of our departure, we forgot our personal keys in the room. When we realized that we forgot our keys, I called the hotel and, to our great relief, they informed me that they found the keys in the room and they promptly mailed them, neatly packed, to my address in France. This is absolutely a great service from the staff of the hotel ! We will return with great pleasure to the Hotel Continental on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, staff were helpful location lovely”
Reviews.Author: brilloclown
Reviews.Content: having read the reviews before I was somewhat concerned. but on arrival staff were freindly and helpful. the location of the hotel is easy to find and stunningly gorgous like all of venice. room was a bit dated but it had a view of the grand canal, yes the grand canal, on the whole people who are picky about the hotel should get out more and enjoy the fabulous city

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOOK HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: webanks
Reviews.Content: We booked a family trip to visit Venice more than 9 months ago and pre-paid our stay. When we arrived in Venice, we tried checking into the Hotel Continental only to be told that "they had problems with some of their rooms" and would have to put us up in a nearby hotel. Of course, that was code language for "we overbooked our hotel and now can't accomodate you." They briskly walked us (not even offering to help us with our luggage) to a hotel that was 1/2 mile away and not nearly as nice as the Continental. Of course we complained - but what options did we have - we had prepaid and all the hotels were booked on the island due to a festival that was underway that weekend? The hotel staff was rude and unprofessional - the only saving grace was that the hotel staff at the location they put us up in tried their best to be kind and helpful to us. Obviously they felt badly too. Nevertheless, I highly recommend that you steer clear from Hotel Continental.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: KiloTango
Reviews.Content: This is a short walk from the Venice train station and only about 100m or so from a vaporeto stop on the grand canal. The rooms were OK, nothing special, but clean and well maintaned. The hotel is a little quirky in that on a given floor, you will have to go up and down a step or two between rooms or witihin rooms. Even after taking the elevator we had to go up and down a few steps to get to our room. Our room even had a level change between the bathroom and the bedroom so go figure. We weren't lucky enough to get a room overlooking the grand canal, but breakfast is served there so if you can get a table, you can enjoy the scene at breakfast. Overall, however, we were entirely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Must be better choices.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler12330087
Reviews.Content: Great location, Good breakfast. Pleasent resturant staff. These were the only 3 good things I can say about this hotel. No view and shutters are locked and allow only 3 inches of light to show thru. One outlet in bathroom and one across from the bed. So bring an extention cord if you need to plug in a device by your night stand. Tiny room with carpet on the floors and walls. Mold in many places. Many of us did not have hot water. But, after all that said, I would not have written this review if it wasn't for the front desk staff. We needed to hand in our key each time we left the hotel... NOT ONCE DID ANY OF THEM SMILE OR SAY HELLO. They wouldn't even make eye contact. Felt like they didn't even want us to be there. Will not book here again.

Reviews.Title: “choose somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: kokokelowna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is yet another maze within the maze that is Venice. I'm by no means dense, or poor with directions, but my room was impossible to find. If there was a fire, I'd be lost. Dingy and hard mattresses, i can cope with; no view whatsoever in my room--a wall. But the staff--truly dour!

Reviews.Title: “What disappointing lodging in an otherwise wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: Fern28
Reviews.Content: We were told the Continental was a "typical European hotel" in Venice. If this is typical, be prepared for dark, dingy, outdated decor; uncomfortably hard mattresses and pillows; a bathroom the size of a small closet, complete with mildew and flying insects; and a staff as dour and grim as the rooms. It's a good thing Venice is a unique and magical place. Surely, Venice has much better to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good , staff are extremly bad”
Reviews.Author: sinanJordan
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is perfect its in the heart of the amazing Venice , the hotel clean not bad although the hot water is not available all the time , but the staff attitude is really so bad they treat the guests in a very bad way , receptionist guys are very angry very in kind and not corroborative even for their duty , Massimo one of i guess that's man didn't like his job or maybe his self and that reflect totally on his attitude and behavior with the guests ,i remembered when w ask him where to dinner in the city he didnt even reply he only hand me the city map and told me " you are in veince you should read about before you came ", bad treatment

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...horrible in EVERY respect...makes Motel 6 look like the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: flag8or
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, it was a horrible experience. No one to help with baggage. Front desk surly and unhelpful. Room was tiny, grimy, and hard to get to with no signage. Elevator is a joke. Can barely fit two people. If you shower, bring a squeegee for the floor. Price was excessive for what they provided. Would not give Internet codes over phone...had to go downstairs to get the codes. No one in lobby when trying to check out. Again, no bell boy. Different front desk person, still surly.second worst hotel stay of my life - worst was a Days Inn in New Orleans after a hurricane! Now that I think of it, THIS was the worst!!!

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe i can see the Grand Canal from my bedroom window!”
Reviews.Author: livetotravel3105
Reviews.Content: What a find! I had a single room, booked with a partial canal view. Number 1..I'm in Venice..i am totally expecting a typical small room..Number 2..booking a room with a partial view..isn't always what it says on the label!..but I had one of those OMG moments when i opened the wooden shutters to reveal an incredible view of the Grand Canal! Ah..Bella Venezia! Ti Amore!! I could've spent 24hrs just leaning out my window and watching the world go by. Gondoliers singing Opera..excited travellers seeing and experiencing Venice for the first time..all the traffic on the Canal. The Hotel is in an amazing position. I had a heavy bag, and having travelled here a few times, I wasn't in the mood and didn't have the energy to be dragging my luggage around Venice.The hotel is literally 5 mins from the Stazione, all flat and no steps. A fantastic area full of your usual touristy shops, but also fabulous restaurants and even a fantastic supermarket. So handy for those.."I just want to have a picnic in my room" kinda days. My favourite. It's a beautiful area and everywhere in Venice is so accessible from this area. All the Ferrovia(Ferry's) are outside your door to transport you and your senses to another, and any world you wish to explore! The rooms were very clean and a good size bathroom. I even had a bath. Aah..the luxury of a good long soak after walking klm's around Venice! I will definitely return to this hotel. I'm sure you will enjoy it too.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ChocFrog75
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel while in Venice for a business meeting. The location is excellent, very near the train station and overlooking the Canal Grande, but the room was dingy, swelteringly hot and a bit worse for wear. Definitely not worth the price they charged. I spent the second night in a cheaper self-catering studio apartment, and it was a better night's sleep than at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the Location”
Reviews.Author: WashedWall
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel with my family from May 24 till May 27. The Location is simply fantastic if you're arriving by Train. We did, and hence were delighted to find that the Hotel was a bare 5 minutes' walk from the Railway Station. When you come out of the Station, turn left and keep walking for approximately 200 metres till you find the Hotel on the right. You don't even need to cross a Bridge (which is quite a rarity in Venice !) Some of the fancier hotels are located around the San Marco area, but personally I found that area a little too touristy and noisy. Moreover, you'd need to take a Vaporetto from the Station (Route 1 or 2) to reach San Marco. Our room was small, but that's what you get in the rest of Europe, so no reason for complaints there. We stayed in Room 373, and it had a large window with a partial view of the Grand Canal. The Hotel is right on the Grand Canal, and even has a landing station for private water taxis (which are terribly expensive). The Room wasn't exactly Lavish, but was clean. The furniture didn't look brand new, but were in good working condition. A Safe was also provided in the Wardrobe. The Bathroom was sparking clean though. Enough clean Towels provided. However, be careful while taking a shower as there is a good possibility of the shower curtain letting out a good amount of the water which would ultimately flood the whole Bathroom. MAJOR CONCERN : The AC didn't work on the first day and night, and we could barely sleep. Venice is Hot in the Summers, and even for people like us coming from a Tropical Climate (India) it can get really uncomfortable at times. No Fan was provided. I wrote a mail to my Travel Agent, and it worked. The second day onwards the AC started running, although it never really managed to keep the Room cool. But we could sleep. That's important. BREAKFAST : The best part about the breakfast was that we could sit right by the Canal, in the morning sun and pleasant breeze and eat. Breakfast is not a lavish spread but I guess you'll find something or the other to suit your taste buds. Canned Juice. Fresh breads. Do not expect anything as grand as the spreads offered by the hotels in S E Asia. Everywhere in Europe, this is generally what you'd get, so I would say I was happy with the Breakfast. There are a string of restaurants and eateries all around the hotel, which is a convenient thing if you choose to have your major meals outside. The Hotel has a restaurant but I never ate there as I found cheaper options outside. There's a Restaurant close by called "Brek". You'll find quick munchies out side and a more detailed spread inside. Recommended. The Front Desk is quiet and efficient but a bit too Professional for my liking. They did answer every query that I put forward (Directions etc) and every information provided was correct. However, there is an air of arrogance which I couldn't really appreciate. A smile here and there and a bit of warmth makes it easier for the Guest. The Hotel has free WiFi and upon asking they give you an username & password. The WiFi was more or less good although occasionally there was an issue with the speed. But you can't expect everything to be perfect, hence I would give a thumbs up to the connection. Room was cleaned every day and it was cleaned very well indeed. Towels were replaced daily. The Hotel has a courtyard of sorts on one side which opens to the Canal, and its a lovely place to sit. It has benches and trees to provide you the shade that you so desperately need in Venice. You can also choose to sit right by the Canal and watch the Venetian life go by. This is a major PLUS. We spent a lot of time here, especially when it got very hot in the Room. A lot of people come here to Eat or Drink or just relax. Overall, I would say this would be a good choice if your primary concern is the Location. However, if you're expecting good facilities AND good air conditioning, you need to look elsewhere and also pay more. With my kind of budget and preferences, I checked out as a happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: mikepahonu
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the 17th and 18th of May booked and paid for 19th extra to the tour only to find a hotel with dirty carpets which smelt of urine, mattress, pillows sheets all old and worst of all infested with bed bugs. we are covered in bites from bed bugs. breakfast a non event wouldnt eat dinner there and bailed as soon as possible with no refund given. bad experience dont go there. renamed hotel incontinent. good brand !

Reviews.Title: “You could find better”
Reviews.Author: jillmalt
Reviews.Content: Good location towards Ferrovia end of Grand Canal. Rooms poky and dark. Service very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: joansven
Reviews.Content: This was a last hotel on a trip through Italy with my husband and daughters. The rooms are tiny, bleak and dingy. The mattresses are soft and incredibly uncomfortable. The hallways are dark. There is one elevator that can hold only two people. We were there in May, so no air conditioning was on yet, but the weather was warm and we needed to keep the one window in the room open, therefore allowing mosquitos into the room. The hotel personnel were rude and not helpful in any way. Any question asked was answered without providing any real help. Don't believe the pictures that the Hotel Continental shows on their website. Very, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Tango27
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. We travel quite a bit and have never stayed in a place as horrible as this, my husband wouldn't even get under the sheet of the bed as he was worried about if they were clean or not. Thank goodness Venice is a cool place to explore and we didn't have to spend much time in the room. The bathroom was old, dirty and tiny, the room itself could have been fine had they cleaned it in the past decade. The carpet was stained walls were paper thin and the staff were not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “ENCHANTED VENICE”
Reviews.Author: mafaldaperdigao
Reviews.Content: HOW TO DESCRIBE VENICE... IT'S NOT EASY... BUT I WILL TRY... THE BEST WAY TO DESCRIBE IS SAYING THAT I FEEL and i imagine I WAS PART OF A SCENARY OF A FILM. when you look at all, the buildings the monuments, the water the boats, it does'nt seems a real city, with living people inside the houses, living there, wortking there, it seems that all the city is created only for tourists visit like a city museum, but it's not like that it is a real place where people live normally...enchanted romantic place... The Hotel Continental Venice, is very well located near the train station and bus stop and also the taxiwater transports. It's a beatifull 3star hotel that was once a rich family palace, its in the canal the rooms are all diferent very cosy wth murano "chandelabres lights" in the ceiling, the breakfast is marvellous, i went in the winter, so i couldn't have the pleasure of having it at the deck over the water of the canal. SÃƒO MARCOS SQUARE IS DIVINAL, evrithin is magical i visit a variety of islads like murano, lido, the cemitery, yesthey have an majestous island to their deads which is beatifull. you can do this visits by waterbus. when i was there venice was inunded i walked in water in s.marcos square... miss venice

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, reasonably priced, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night last week with colleagues. We had booked it because we were arriving by car (which we left overnight in Piazzale Roma) and it was only a short walk from there with our suitcases. We paid Â£280 for 3 single rooms (double beds) including breakfast, which is very reasonable for Venice and were pleasantly surprised by the rooms, though the views left a bit to be desired. (I had a nice view across a little square and could also see the Grand Canal if I stuck my head out of the window, but my colleagues both had rooms which faced a wall 6 feet across!) We also had our bags carried up to them by a porter which was great as though there is a lift, the hotel is a bit of a rabbit warren inside and it is easier to take the stairs. Reception staff were quick and pleasant and the buffet breakfast was fine. Location wise, this is easy to find - a 10 minute across the bridge from Piazzale Roma and 5 minutes from the train station, on the main walkway towards the Rialto and San Marco. We only stayed here for one night but if I were to come to Venice for leisure purposes and for a longer stay, I would be more than happy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of our family's best experiences.”
Reviews.Author: AdvocatusDiaboliAU
Reviews.Content: We had some good and some bad hotels in Italy. This one was the best by far. We arrived by train and this hotel was a nice short walk from the station. The English speaking staff were friendly and efficient. They dealt with the guest very well (and there was a lot of them when we arrived) and we were processed very quickly. They gave us a beautiful canal view room which was spacious and clean (including the bathroom). Location-wise, great to be close to the station, but still about an hours walk to St Marco's which we did 2-3 times a day! We had dinner at St Marco's square one night and it was overpriced and food was akin to a frozen microwave dinner, so we decided to have dinner at the hotel the following night. We got a table right on the canal and given fantastic silver service with great food and half the price we paid at the restaurant in St Marco's. The headwaiter recommended the angler fish, to which we accepted. It was one of the simplest dish, yet the most delicious fish dishes I have ever had. The risotto and scalopine was also fantastic. My wife and daughter were treated like royalty even though we dressed like tourists. The only bad thing I can say (apart from being a far away from St Marco's) is that the wifi service was poor in my room; I had to open my door to get half decent reception. Other than that, I loved the hotel room; it was inexpensive, spacious, clean and service from all hotel staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Mercury75
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 6 nights. Old fashioned Italian hotel, needs refurbishment BUT be positive. Room, bed firm matteress like us Europeans like, and bathroom/shower spotlessly clean, clean towels everyday. Hot water morning and night, and Yes, the hotel was nearly full. Excellent buffet breakfast, caffe/latte fresh coffee and milk. If you are not so mobile ask not to be put on the 4th floor, you need to negotiate 20 steps. Did half board, evening meal fine, 4 courses modest portions but you can't complain for 20 Euro, Bottle of wine 22 Euros. .Found staff very professional and helpful, and I felt comfortable as a female solo traveller. Location 12 minute walk from Piazzale Roma with case easy crossing over new bridge(the one lit up). Vaporetto stops 100 metres from hotel. 25 minute walk to San Marco. Sleep, well wherever you go in Venice you are going to get a noise. Wear earplugs, but the church will wake you up next door at 07:00. I don't have any dislikes about this hotel. And one more thing, the Hotel exchange money and don't ask for commission. A good budget hotel. Two tips, behind the vaporetto stops at Piazzale Roma there is the Post office, and a Co-op supermarket which opens 08:30 until 20:00 everyday, they don't close for lunch. Secondly, buy a vaporetto pass, for either 12,24,48 or 72 hours or 7 days, you save loads of money. and at about 19:00 the vaporetti aren't very busy, do an evening tour around the canals especially the grande canale it is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MB0001
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Continental for 2 nights and really enjoyed it. We arrived late at night and staff were friendly, took our bags to our room and made us welcome. The location was good - it was very easy to find from the train/bus station and you can easily get on the Vaporetti to San Marco and Rialto (or walk if you have some time) Our room was small, but very clean and simply decorated. The bathroom was nice, with a great shower and the view from our window over looking the grand canal was brilliant. Our bed was comfy and we wern't disturbed by noise from other rooms or the street. Breakfast was ok - with a choice of cereals, croissants, rolls, bacon and eggs. The only down side was that it was served from 7.30 - 10 (we arrived at 9) and they had pretty much run out of hot food and did not replace it. All in all a very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Zentrale Lage, guter Service”
Reviews.Author: Rick_5408
Reviews.Content: Wer keine Koffer schleppen will geht ins Continental. Sehr nahe an Bahnhof, Busstopp und Carparking. Danach erkundet man die Stadt zu vus oder mit dem Wasserbus. Die Zimmer waren eher klein aber ordentlich. Grosses Hotel jedoch gut organisiert. Sehr reichhaltiges Morgenessen. Trotz Nebensaison muss fÃ¼r das gute Restaurant eine Reservation vorgenommen werden. Nettes, hÃ¶fliches, hilfreiches Personal.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient and well located hotel overlooking the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: nellarm
Reviews.Content: Not having visited Venice before, we chose Hotel Continental on location and price. Being only a short walk from the Piazzale Roma and adjacent to the Grand Canal, we were well pleased with our choice! Our room, overlooking the canal, was clean, comfortable and promptly serviced. The food in the restaurant was good, again with attentive service. Overall, we assess our 3 day stay at Hotel Continental as most pleasurable and good value.

Reviews.Title: “damp and mouldy”
Reviews.Author: twistedvic
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a great location on the grand canal and the rooms small which did not bother me. Unfortunately my room was damp including the bed and carpet. The staff were also rude and couldnt care less.They seem to feel if you dont like it someone else will put up with it.The management has no incentive to improve. I will say that one waiter we found was very friendly and accomodating but he was the exception. All in all i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: Continental Hotel was definitely better than what I expected it to be. The room was quite nice with a beautiful view of the canal. And the restaurant where we had our dinner had a lovely ambiance. After staying at an awful hotel / or rather awful room - at Oxford hotel in Rome, I was impressed with the quality and standard of service at Continental. If you are looking for a good 3* / 4* hotel, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: denisons
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. We landed with an Insight Group. Rude reception who when told about cold showers only answered you in Italian could not care attiteude., but same person (Owner) could give people a lecture in plain English re carrying your room ID to collect key. Evening meal poor and warm beer in a wine glass . Breakfast below average e.g. no fruit juice only cordial, cold coffee and tea. No response when asked for a hot cup. . If this hotel is ranked 3.5 stars it is a long way short of other hotels who get same rating. It is not a member of a group privately owned and obviously staff have no enjoymen to in working there for Basil. How could you clean a teribly old room with no space. No soap holders, No bracket to hold shower wand.

Reviews.Title: “no longer a millionaires estate”
Reviews.Author: brownfootedboobie
Reviews.Content: still renovating the rooms ,you may receive a room in poor condition.beds fairly comfortable some bathrooms were missing curtains . location is right near the bus area abit ofa walk from st. marks.

Reviews.Title: “Hit the jackpot”
Reviews.Author: Natasha09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as one of the hotels on our coach tour of Europe. After reading the reviews here and being warned not to expect much from the Italian hotels on our tour we felt like we had hit the jackpot. Our room had a beautiful view of the Grand Canal and although not huge was spacious enough with a full sized bathroom including bath tub. Given it was Venice we didn't spend a huge amount of time in the hotel but time there was pleasant enough. An included dinner in the hotel restaurant was pleasant enough with gracious service from the wait staff, breakfasts were a little basic although there were still a range of hot and cold choices. Location was incredibly connenient after getting lost a couple of times we discovered it was about a 40 minute walk to St Marks square and what a fantastic walk.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly_in_ChiTown
Reviews.Content: Don't go here if you want to SLEEP. We DIDNT read reviews on this hotel before booking - and boy did we wish we HAD. Got into the room and IMMEDIATELY one of our party had a horrible allergy attack from the MOLD in this place - complete with vomitting - which rarely happens to her. WTH?? So that was the first 30 minutes in our new room. Can you tell it's not going to be great?? Raw sewage smell coming from bathroom pipes was pretty gross. But we were determined to tough it out. We figured we'll be in Venice just 1 nite and we would ignore the room problems. After a late night out in Venice (which IS beautiful), we are in about midnight. I am holding my nose whilst soaking my feet in the pitted stained bath tub -- when I realize the water in tub doesn't drain. AT ALL. So how will 3 people be showering tomorrow morning??? <*sigh!*> One of our party had taken sleeping pills and did not want to be disturbed until checkout the next day as she would be driving us. I call hotel service to fix tub and he cannot do it. "You must wait and we will get back to you". ??? After sitting around teh hotel room for an HOUR, with one of us in a sleeping-pill-induced-zombie-like state, all in our PJs dying for bed....we get the message that "you can change rooms" or else "we will have plumber there in the morning" (clattering about while we TRY to sleep). Neither option was good but desperate for sleep in the morning we took the Room Change. We all sat around in our pajamas like sleep deprived zombies for ANOTHER HOUR while "waiting for the room change" to be finalized. Which apparently was about as difficult as brain surgery by the amount of time it took to do it! And don't call and rush them b/c then it takes MUCH MUCH LONGER...take my word for this. We'd been driving around Italy on NO SLEEP for the past 48 hours and desperately needed to crash - but no such luck at THIS hotel. Finally the room change is finalized! We had to BEG just to get a porter to help us move our bags. Then, after ANOTHER long wait, someone appears to help haul ALL OUR BAGS OUT OF OUR ROOM AT NEARLY 2 AM!! In the US, they would offer you a discount without a second thought for all this BS, and they would APOLOGIZE. At THIS hotel? Oh no. When I asked for a discount for all this inconvenience, I heard: "We cannot give discount because we give you a room change. It is NOT possible!" NICE. There was MUCH arguing but the hotel manager REFUSED to budge. Apparently people go to hotels in Venice to check in a midnight, stay up until 2 am or later, waiting around for plumbers and room changes, and then sleep for an hour or two, before CHECKING OUT and driving on the AutoStrada -- andthat is just NO BIG DEAL. ??? Not even worthy of the smallest discount. Also, one of our party accidentally left a nice Movado watch behind - but do you think they mailed it to the home address they had on file for us? NOPE! Moldy, decrepit rooms that smelled like SEWAGE, coupled with horrendous customer service. The worst.

Reviews.Title: “Only if necessary”
Reviews.Author: marmendes
Reviews.Content: Small room, stinky room toilets, small furniture. At reception presence of rude staff. Very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: vmvpinay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner during our South Italy tour and I just love it. From the moment we stepped at the hotel I'm in love. Its clean, staff are helpful and accomodating, well maintained and I love the room!! Its roomy, light and comfy and super clean! The food is superb! And the staff at their restaurant are also very good. The location is great too, walking distance to the Train Station and bus station. A lot of shops and restaurants nearby. One thing you won't like about this hotel is that it's a maze to go to your room, its quite difficult to navigate the staircases without a guide and I'm not so good with directions so I letft the navigation with my partner. The hotel staffs carry our bag upon check in and check out which is good, I can't imagine myself carrying my bags with all these staircases, we just left out bag outside our door when we checked out and they brought it at the lobby. There's an elevator but going to our room the staircase is the nearest. Other than that, everything is beyond my expectations. Will i recommend this hotel?? 100!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaPaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location if you want to get in and out of Venice - but if you want a good lcoation for while you're staying in venice - then this is a bit out of the way. The good thing about being close to the bus / train etc - you don't have to drag your bags too far when you arrive as baggage mafia charge about $10 for every bag to get it to your room on a boat. The main thing about this hotel is that the rooms are tiny. However, we did hear other people say their rooms were okay. The rooms were just big enough to fit a double bed while some rooms had big bathrooms, some had small - we had to squeeze sideways to get into the shower. Like alot of Italy the rooms are old and falling apart - while the Italians don't do alot about it - they can't the places are just old. So you need to relax and take it all in without worrying about your surroundings and forget evening trying to tell the reception staff of your worries - it will just give you more of a headache.

Reviews.Title: “I got sick with Gillian Barret and had to be on a hospital because of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lbcr1949
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not honor our reservation of 4 rooms because an excursion of asians paid more for our rooms we had a confirm reservations 2 months prior and they send us to a 1 star hotel they did not refund our money at this hotel my wife got gillian barret because of an awful room and spend a month on the verge of death the other couples had a skin rash an need antibiotics to get better worst service and almost a fatality because of this

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieSharon
Reviews.Content: The Continental is at the Station end of the Grand Canal, and as far as eating and shopping this is the more economical area than up around St Marks Square. It is also handy if you are taking a cruise from Venice as it is walking distance to the bus terminal where the cruise shuttles go from. The hotel is on the canal and we had windows facing it which was wonderful, and the hotel has a nice terrace restaurant so you can have breakfast on the canal too. Our room was spacious as was the bathroom, and the decor very Venetian. It has tea and coffee facilities but no fridge. It is not a modern hotel but has a lot of charm and is well located, the staff were friendly and compared to other hotels we stayed in in Italy was one of the best. Don't get me wrong, it is not a grand property, but for one of those on the Island you pay a fortune, but this is good value for money, comfortable and well located and I would stay there again. It also offered free WIFI

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel... Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ellie13_14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 3 nights for a short break to Venice... The Location was great as coming from the airport, you can get the bus, boat or train all to the stop next to the train station which was literally a 3 minute walk from the hotel. It is right on the Grand Canal unlike a lot of other hotels we saw on the back alleys... Although it is not near St Marks Square, we preferred this as we then got to see more of Venice than just the main tourist area. There is a lot of local shops, food markets and stalls on the doorstep of the hotel. The hotel is very nice from the lobby area and the staff were really nice, helpful and professional. They were there 24/7 and couldn't ask for better staff from the receptionists to the chefs to the waiters! The hotel was reasonably priced although we did upgrade to a better room with views over the canal which I would definitely recommend. Our room was on the first floor with large windows opening out to the canal.... beautiful!! The room was a good size, very clean and the bathroom was perfect. The only fault was that it was 2 single beds pushed together but this was not a problem and that does happen a lot in hotels. The whole hotel was very clean, the staff excellent, the breakfast was lovely although don't go in the last half hour as they didn't seem to cook more. Location was perfect, overall great!! Was lovely to wake up to open the windows to the locals doing their business of delivering goods and sitting on the balcony to eat breakfast (which a lot of hotels didnt). Would definitely recommend but you should upgrade to a river-view room! its definitely worth the extra after reading some other reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Debbie66MonroeCT
Reviews.Content: I was wary of this hotel after reading some reviews here, so my family & I were pleasantly surprised to find it so great! It probably depends on which area your room is in. We were with a tour. Our room was on the top floor, and the stairs were definitely a challenge, but I figured it was good conditioning for our tour. Our room, which was set up for 3 of us, was at the front of the hotel, overlooking the little cobblestone street. The view from the room was beautiful. The room was clean, bathroom esp. seemed updated. Good A/C, no bad smells. The food in the dining room and nice little terrace on the canal was quite good. I wasn't that thrilled about any of the employees - I think it may have been the beginning of their busy season and they were feeling a bit overwhelmed - but the location of this hotel and the 2 rooms my family had were just great!

Reviews.Title: “FInd somewhere better to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mitsi2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a Insight tour and were extremely disappointed that we were in this level of accommodation. Although very close to the Grand Canal and railway station the room was less than 'ordinary'. Very small and dingy and not helped by the fact that we were advised to leave the shutters closed in case they fell apart when being opened! There was a smell of sewage emanating from the bathroom and, on our second morning, absolutely no hot water at all. The shower cubicle was so small that we had some difficulty squeezing in and out of it. The rooms that we and other members of our tour were in bore no resemblance at all to those shown on the hotels' website.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 star hotel I've stayed at in Venice for location and service.”
Reviews.Author: dotfergie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Continental is literally 5 minutes walk from Santa Lucia Station and very easy to find. It fronts on to the Grand Canal and having breakfast overlooking the canal is just spectacular. Breakfast is outstanding with a huge selection and the best coffee. The restaurant is excellent. The rooms are a reasonable size for Venice, clean and well serviced. The hotel is situated in the Cannaregio district right in the middle of great shopping - and a much cheaper place to buy than the San Marco area. San Marco is a 20 minute walk if you don't shop on the way. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a let down”
Reviews.Author: swissjo
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, which I wouldn't recommend, book the nicest room they have, on the canal. Otherwise, you could end up with a room like we did, no. 155. It was the most awful room I have ever experienced. One tiny little window, very prison-cell-like. Old old carpet, bedcover and wallpaper (peeling), supposed to non-smoking but the stale smoke smell was palpable. Terrible bed. That said, we immediately requested another room and the hotel did move us the next day. The other room, 4123, was small but nice enough, and so much better that we were thrilled to have it! Breakfast is ok and reception wasn't very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in city of islands”
Reviews.Author: gobabu
Reviews.Content: It is very good hotel located in city centre. From here we easily got water taxis, comfortable plae to travel to st. marks square. Near by we have good shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Saikhnaa
Reviews.Content: Located near the Grand Canal, it was not bad place to stay. Wi-fi internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: NanaKaren181
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice quite a few times and have stayed in all manner of hotels (3, 4 and 5 star); and I can say that this was the worst hotel I stayed in in Venice. The rooms were small, dark and dingy and none too clean. There was a distinct odor of sewage in the bathroom. The servers in the dining room were quite rude, had to literally beg for coffee in the morning. The breakfast buffet was the worst I've had in a hotel in Italy. The hotel advertised a bar, but there was none. The hotel staff was barely adequate and sometimes quite rude. Would not stay there again and would not recommend. I stayed there as part of a Grand Circle Tour, and I must say I was quite disappointed in this hotel and with Grand Circle for choosing it.

Reviews.Title: “It's a gamble!”
Reviews.Author: Aeola
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently on an Insight Tour. Judging by other photos on this site, the rooms are vastly different so it's the luck of the draw! Our room was dark and dingy but at least didn't smell of mould like the rooms of some of the other tour members. The bath had a hand held shower at bath level with no curtain or screen so if you showered higher than your knees you showered the bathroom! However, it was clean and right on the canal. We absolutely loved Venice and were only in the room to sleep but I think our room would be lucky to get to 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location right on the Granc Canal”
Reviews.Author: shoebits
Reviews.Content: A little pricey put if you're traveling by train the location is great! Comfortable, air-conditioned rooms with a well appointed bathrooms. Our rooms really didn't have a view but that wasn't a problem for us. The breakfast deck right on the Grand Canal is wonderful (if you get there early enough to get a seat!). Convenient hotel safe in room. Only thing missing was a small fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: traveleasy60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while on a coach holiday to Italy. The rooms are clean and although they are not spacious there is enough room to move around. The hotel is located next to the Grand Canal and very handy for the boats, trains and only 10mins walk to the bus terminus. It is central for getting to all the attractions in Venice. We enjoyed our stay here There is an internet cafe two doors away.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: susanbtucson
Reviews.Content: rooms are gross. Dark and hard to find. Lots of steps. Bathrooms are horrible. When you take a shower water everywhere. The beds are really bad and the view stinks. This is not a three staR hotel. start looking for something else. The location is not in the center of Venice so its a long way to see the sights. There are plenty of others to chose from...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: djkamp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after my plans changed during a motorcycle tour in Northern Italy. Having a couple of extra days, and having not seen Venice, I decided to take the train in by myself. I needed something close as I was temporarily injured and couldn't walk well. I got a single room on the top floor with just a single bed and a nice view of the canal. It was clean, had a nice bath, and the small room was great with limited mobility. I would reccomend this hotel based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “dream come true”
Reviews.Author: leetanMontreal_Quebe
Reviews.Content: Upon reading the reviews, I have to wonder if I stayed at the same hotel. We had booked one night ....great value, close to the train station and on the Grand Canal..didn't expect too much. Our room was a dream...2 windows ont he Grand Canal , comfortable bed, more than adequate furnishings and a great bathroom. After our first night, we loved it so much we stayed an extra night. The location was perfect, staff were more than friendly and accomodating and breakfast exquisite. I will definitely stay there if ever in Venice again!

Reviews.Title: “Continental was OK”
Reviews.Author: littleida
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The breakfast was good and people were quite nice. Some negative sides it had too, for example the bathroom was a bit small and if you are a lucky one you cant see anything from the window. Location was 5 min from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “View of the Grand Canal, but not the room you'd really want”
Reviews.Author: TravelLab
Reviews.Content: Anywhere else in the world, I'd hate this place, but it is Venice, so I'm forging of many of the sins simply because of the location. We stayed in room 265, which did have a view of the grand canal, not a great one, but one none-the-less. As we traveled with others, they mentioned they didn't have the view, but their rooms certainly sounded better fitted, heated towel racks, shower curtains, etc. Our room had a tub with shower head, no glass door, no shower curtain, nada. Pros: Close to the water bus station, so easy to get around "cheaply". Decent breakfast, dinner at the hotel was quite nice, we were tired, but there are many nearby choices, but prepare to eat late, many don't open until 7PM. Cons: You know those little baskets of soaps and shampoos people leave to keep, won't find those here, just little packs of soap. 265 has no radiator, so no way to dry out soaked clothing. Venice was flooding while we were there, so pants and shoes were soggy. The dining room for breakfast (see photo), small add-on to the building, metal chairs in December equals one very cold dining experience. My advice, wear a coat, or bring a towel.

Reviews.Title: “great memory.thank you travelnotesitaly.com”
Reviews.Author: RomeAsja
Reviews.Content: we hade a great time.surfing the web we did contact travelnotesitaly.com.they took care of everything and they have organized for us an unique memory in venice. tom and sue

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: perfectwave
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay whilst touring with ATI tours 10-12th September '08. Italian tour company Carrani was the provider. The room was old school, candelwick bedspreads over two twin beds to make a double, tiny room and the handbasin leaked whenever the plug was stopped. A most unromantic hotel. We stayed at B&Bs in the UK which were far superior by standard than this supposed 4 star hotel. The only thing going for it was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: heregoes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while touring Italy with Insight Tours. Of the 8 hotels we stayed in while visiting Italy, this was definitely the worst. I am aware that European standards are different than North American, but this hotel is badly in need of renovation. The air conditioners are noisy and don't always work (we had to switch rooms), the paint and wallpaper is chipping and peeling, the colours are dark and depressing. Our room had a view of the garbage dump. The dining room feels "cellar-like" and the front desk staff are curt and this was the only hotel where we felt this. The lobby is the only nice part of the hotel. Our friend who was travelling as a single was given a room that looked more like a jail cell. The location is good as people have said but I couldn't wait to leave this hotel. A flat-screen tv is not important to me--there's too much to see in Italy to be waching TV.

Reviews.Title: “good location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NimbusWi
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - near the train station and water busses. Request a room overlooking the grand canal. Breakfast was great and staff very helpful. Rooms are "ok" - linens etc just adequate - but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kmart24
Reviews.Content: Personally, my experience with the Hotel Continental was pleasant overall. I stayed there while on a 12-day trek around Italy with Insight Tours. We stayed in The Hotel Continental for one night, and I enjoyed it. I thought it was one of the nicest hotels I had stayed in so far in Italy. The room was large, the beds, however slightly hard, I was not complaing about. People forget that they are visiting Europe. Their showers are different, their beds are hard because that's how they prefer them, they don't have all the accomodations and excess perks that and American hotel would have. When you stay at an Italian hotel, you should expect to do things as the Romans do, or in this case, the Venetians. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience of Italian hotels. If I wanted oversized, squishy beds, showers with curtains, and complimentary tea and coffee makers in my room, I would have stayed in an American hotel on the mainland. I don't think the Continental needs an 'modernizing'. It's classic and elegant. I found it larger than many of the other Italian Hotels' rooms, cleaner, the staff friendlier, and the location couldn't be rivaled. It was beautiful, with a unique layout. I've never had more fun finding my room! I highly recommend that if you're going to Venice to truly experience all aspects of it. If you prefer not to experience what it is to stay in a traditional, Italian 3-star hotel in the city of Venice, then I would recommend the hotels on the mainland. As far as I'm concerned, I plan on making a return trip to Venice, and I'll be booking my stay with Continental.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoranBarcelona
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days in this hotel before going on cruise with Costa Cruceros. It was an average 3 star hotel. All the staff was very polite. I only can remember the name of the receptionists that I saw: Massimo and Franco, and also Luigina from the Restaurant. All of them were very nice. My room was 311 and it has a nice view over the Gran Canal. I'll upload some pictures I took there. The only thing I don't like that there was no WIFI nor any kind of internet connection in the Hotel. I had to go to a ciber cafÃ© which was 3 minutes from the hotel. Apart from that everything was perfect. I ate and I had my dinner in the Hotel and I liked it very much. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Continental not for me”
Reviews.Author: Englishdreams
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Continental Hotel Venice while on an Insight Italian Escapade Tour. I was travelling alone. Room was size of my walk in closet with hard bed, bad linens, broken safe and step up to bathroom. No hot water or air conditioning for the two days and long nights I was there. Hotel felt dirty. Buffet breakfast was ok, dinner was ok. Staff were less than friendly and not helpful at all. I would not recommend to an enemy. Loved Venice but could not wait to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: BootBuckles
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the elegant lobby and professional staff that welcomed me promptly and efficiently. I was led to a small room that was clean and sufficient for my one night stay. The bed was firm and comfortable. One thing that should be changed is the shower which due to the low basin, spilled water all over the bathroom floor. At night, the neighborhood is a bit noisy but closing the windows and having earplugs helped greatly. i would definetly stay there again when in Venice. The complimentary satisfying breakfast had ample to choose from; fruits, 3 types of croissants, several types of bread for toast, variety of jams, two types of cereal, hardboiled eggs, scrambled eggs. The hotel is in a convenient location and the neighborhood has many stores, restaurants, and cafes open till late. Although not very close to St. Marks Square, the vaporettos are a great fun cheap way to see the beautiful city. Sometimes the best part of traveling is getting there :) FYI- The train station is just a minute walk away from the hotel and by vaporetto, the bus station is one stop (P. de la Roma) away. Bus number 5 takes you to the Marco Polo Airport. The hotel is at the Ferrovia vaporetto stop. Have fun in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: princess416
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at a great rate for a single room facing the canal. Friends stayed in a beutiful large room for 1 night facing the canal for under 150 Euros! This hotel has a great location close to the Ferrovia (Railway Station) and the Piazella Roma. Just steps from the Ghetto district which is less busy and has some fabulous inexpensive restaurants. In North america a location near the bus and train station usually means bad area...not in Europe! This location was perfect for getting around in Venice. I came off a cruise ship and took the free shuttle to the Piazella Roma. Then I grabbed a vaporetto from the PR to the Ferrovia (1 stop) and got off and walked the block to the hotel....total cost - 3 euros! The hotel will send a water taxi to the cruise ship terminal for the low price of 110Euros! Make sure you drop your large luggage at the baggage hold place next to the Pullman Bar - you DEFINATELY do not want to be dragging luggage all over Venice! When you leave just go in reverse and pick your luggage up - walk across the street to the airport bus and total cost 6Euros. Be sure to get a pass on the vaporettos for the length of time you are there.... Now - the hotel - great lobby - front desk staff are professional but not overly friendly - I found this to be true around Italy. The room was clean but small - which was ok for me. Great bathroom! Hotel is charming and there are some renovations going on but no noise from it. If you take a room on the Canal and sleep with your windows ope - be prepared for noise. Venice is alive at the crack of dawn with much hoopla! It is part of the charm I think! Like the Ramblas in Barcelona. Great gelato from the cart down the street on the way to the Rialto! Breakfast was fine - good coffee - avoid the juice - nice croissants and hard boiled eggs! If you eat on the patio by the canal hold your hand out and the little birds will jump right up to get a crumb! I liked the hotel and would return there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “needs modernising”
Reviews.Author: PeteNorthWestUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our three nights in Venice. The staff were friendly both on reception and in the restaurant (which, I would recommend). Then you go up to the room......................................... Awful! Very poor. The beds, furniture and decor are all in need of replacement and, a good clean wouldn't go amiss. The location isn't great. It's not near St Marks square or the Rialto bridge. I read other reviews with bewilderment, leading me to ask whether or not there are two hotel continentals??!! It is approx 20 mins by 'water bus' to the Rialto area and approx 30 mins to St Marks square. All in all I would say 'book elsewhere'.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Charm”
Reviews.Author: ptadin
Reviews.Content: If you're arriving by train at Santa Lucia Railway Station or need to depart for Marco Polo Airport from Piazzale Roma (bus depot), this 500 year old hotel is hard to beat for location. It is situated right on the Grand Canal and offers incredible charm in this beautiful city. The rooms were nicely appointed and full of charm. It was almost a vacation by itself to just stay in the room. The TV's are flat panels. The bathrooms are good, except it would be better if there was a shower curtain for the tub so you don't flood out the bathroom. The hotel offers a full American style breakfast with hot and cold food, but the orange juice was watered down. The lobby area was inviting, large, and comfortable. The staff were very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and service”
Reviews.Author: susanCarlisle
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel set in the centre of Venice between St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. It is in a quiet square and has an old fashioned atmosphere. The staff are great and very helpful. The room was on suite (it was small) overlooking the square.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Trent1990
Reviews.Content: I am a single traveller and I was looking for a cheap basic hotel in Venice in early November, so I did a google search before I came to the city, and I booked this hotel since it looked to be adequate and all that I needed. When I stayed in Venice the first time, a month earlier, it was a different hotel, and I thought I would change to something a little cheaper, like this one. I was checked in by the friendly staff on front desk, (the English was great), and was then taken to my wonderfully clean, modern, fully equipped room, which had the most stunning view of the Grand Canal that I have ever seen. It was just a single room of course, with all private ammenities, but I was impressed from the moment I stepped in. Service, cleanliness, layout of the hotel, and that view! Amazing. I have found that in Venice even one tiny obstructed view of any water, and the hotel's bump up the price well into the hundreds, but this hotel really is something special. I would recommend it to absolutely anyone. I know without a doubt this will be my first preference to stay at next time I visit Venice. Keep this one a secret!

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: We were staying only one night in Venice so weren't looking for anything fancy. One of the tourist agencies at the train station recommended this place. It's conveniently close to the station. We had a room on the ground floor overlooking the canal. The bathroom had no tub, shower only, but not a problem for us. Breakfast was satisfactory. So this hotel was fine for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near station”
Reviews.Author: fabiolina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group 4/13/07. Located 50 mts from train station. Typical Venetian hotel, labyrintine hallways, etc. Rooms are adequate but clean. Convenient to vaporetto stops at train station. Staff at desk nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “On the Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zetts
Reviews.Content: This is a good location near the train station. Many hotels in this area -- but off the beaten path. The room was small but ok, like many european hotesl -- no shower curtain in the bathroom, which was a pain. If all the laundry has to be taken by boat off the island, one wonders way they don't put up a curtain so you don't have to use 4 towels to mop the floor! Wouldn't recommend the restaurtant -so so, but many fine restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place by the train station”
Reviews.Author: thisiskristine
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here and it was nice. Right by the train station and that's convenient. We just stayed here to sleep, so it did the job. No complaints. Nice place and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting introduction to Venice”
Reviews.Author: bltzflk
Reviews.Content: Grand Circle Travel arranged our stay and we were happy with their choice. The hotel, an amalgam of ancient buildings merged into one, is quaint, not a modern "box" with all rooms the same. Our room was adequate and clean, the food was not outstanding but was satisfying, the front desk was helpful and the location is wonderful, right on the Grand Canal, only a short walk from the vaporetto (water bus) and close to many different restaurants and shops, Overall, we had no complaints and were quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Get a Grand Canal View or forget it”
Reviews.Author: Cugno
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the last week of Sept 2006. We a room facing the canal which was brilliant BUT the hotel itself was most disappointing.....You get very little service or help and you are made to feel as if you are an inconvenience. They do not provide irons nor do they understand the concept of a cold beer....I sent mine back and asked for a refund. Breakfast was average...they appear to use powdered milk, toaster did not toast, scrambled eggs appear to be reconstituted and dont offer guests expresso as part of breakfast )and it is Italy!!) It was pretty poor BUT the view was spectacular

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel on the grand canal away from saint mark's square”
Reviews.Author: trinity-tiger
Reviews.Content: this hotel was part of my insight amazing italy tour this hotel was right on the grand canal, but away from saint mark's square the included dinner was excellent as was the breakfast buffet this hotel used large keys instead of the more modern electronic keys did not provide internet aservice in the lobby if i'm in venice again, i might choose a different hotel i am from san antonio, texas

Reviews.Title: “800 yr old charmer”
Reviews.Author: Winniefan
Reviews.Content: What a place - part of 5 700 year old palaces joined togethger. All on different levels so got to lift bags etc up and down steps. Charming old character with Queen Anne cream and gold hand painted antique type furniture and chandelier in room. Very small ensuite but adequate - you would not want to be obese to fit in the shower!! Fantastic location in middle of shoping lanes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - value & service”
Reviews.Author: tura
Reviews.Content: Have recently spent 5 nights which was booked by our travel agent in Australia. Our room was spacious, recently refurbished, very pleasant furnishings and windows right on the canal as requested. Location was great as we left by train and simply walked to the station. Can't believe I am talking about the same hotel as some of the reviews! Breakfast was more than adequate and we dined twice - excellent food and service. Reception desk were extremely helpful with advice - no complaints from us and we would most definitely stay again. And it was inexpensive! Tura, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you are looking for ambience”
Reviews.Author: gamblinfool
Reviews.Content: I have read other reviews of this hotel on other websites and unfortunately I failed to read them. The majority of the reviewers on other sites rated their experience at this hotel as poor. No site as of yet has a rating that adequately describes my experience. The reviewers from NY, NY and their photos match mine. I will try to be brief. We were on a budget, but I would rather sleep near the Grand Canal or any canal outside than repeat a stay at this rat trap. My sister and I had a room that was on the first floor with a view of the alley and wall - consequently it was always dark. The hallways were dark, the bathroom was dark, and yes, shower curtains and wash cloths are nonexistent in Europe apparently. The other guests that spoke English had similar rooms. Although you do not spend a great deal of time in the hotel, when you do it would be nice if it were pleasant. I would consider the conditions of a good majority of the rooms deplorable. Since this was the last leg of our trip in Italy and the room was prepaid, we simply endured the place. One night it was very cold - about 38 F - we called the desk and asked that the a/c be turned on for heat. We couldn't get the thermostat to respond. We were told that the a/c didn't work, but they would be glad to bring extra blankets. We decided that the modern conveniences that you see in the room are really Hollywood props - they give you a false sense of being in the 21st century; however, you are really reliving the renaissance period. I found only one concierge who made our stay barely tolerable, the others were downright rude. My advice for travelers on a budget - find and carefully review B&B's or pensiones. There a quite a few in this section of Venice (Cannareggio). They would be a palace compared to this atrocity calling itself a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the end of April for 3 nights. The location is good and I found the hotel clean but dissapointing, the breakfast was adequate, but so uninspiring, considering the beautiful, cheap, local produce, there was no decent bread or fresh fruit etc and the ? fresh fruit juice is so watered down!!. The staff were not rude, but just indifferent. The room we had was tired and dull and had no shower curtain which meant the bathroom got soaked every time you had a shower. The city itself is a knockout, but I feel the attitude is that tourists will come to Venice no matter what, so why make an effort, which is such a shame as it would take very little flair to change this hotel into something special.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem!!! The location is great and the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The room we had was a little out dated (and bed somewhat hard) but very clean. The bath was great with a large tub and also very clean. We stayed for 3 nights and would definately go back again. The breakfast was more than enough variety and the bread pudding was terrific! The location - right on the Grand Canal - it worth everything and hey, you're in Venice, how much time should you be sleeping anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Europes Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CBDAustralia
Reviews.Content: Congratulations, Hotel Continental Venice, you are Europes worst hotel. I have never experienced such poor and rude service. The location was average, but the quality of the facilities was dreadful. I checked out after my first night.

Reviews.Title: “unpretentious hotel continental”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel in nov 2005. The best thing about this hotel is location, it is also very easy to find,get the bus from the airport to piazza de la roma, and walk within 2-3 mins. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and a good breakfast was served. The rooms were nothing special, but very clean and were cleaned daily through our stay. considering you get what you pay for, we found this to be a great place to stay and would return. Dont eat at restaurants on the lista de spagna as you will be left short of pocket and disapointed

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: frankcom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Continental from Oct. 13th to 16th, 2005. It's an old building, but in good condition and the little elevator works. The room was large, which was a surprise. It is located at the north end of the Grand Canal, near the train station, a good distance from the tourism center. But it is still in a busy walk-around area. Connections to St. Mark's through water taxis or vaporettos are easy. Yes, as I saw in other reviews, there was a slight odor coming from the drain system, but it was very minor and did not bother us at all. We'd go back there without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Continental - Less than your average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a slow checkin, the room was less than average. The room was small with no air-conditioning. When we opened the window, we overlooked a small alley which was noisy until early morning. The window pane was loose, making the opening of the window a very cautious activity to avoid window pane falling out. So much for facing the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: jjob80
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Continental, I was very nervous given the reviews I read. We were very happy it was located so close to the train station as we had heavy bags. The service could not have been better, Mario was wonderful, he spent time to outline the best things to see in Venice, got us tickets to the Vivaldi Concert and was always happy to help. The room...typical for European hotels, small, but clean and we basically just slept there. Loved the dining area on the Grand Canal, where we ate breakfast every morning, which also was quite satisfying. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, close to the train station and Roma Plazza. The service is bad. As the matter of fact, they do not have any service. It is more the attitude of pay-and-stay. Smile? help? No way. I think they really don't care about or have no concept of customer satisfaction. Who cares? There are so many visitors coming to the city. You stay one night or two. They do not expect to see you again. I do not recommend this hotel, but I seriously doubt, in Venice, most of the hotels have very similar service.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but IN Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lyb
Reviews.Content: Like so many others who have already posted a review, I stayed at this hotel while on a tour. The location of the hotel is good, if coming by train, not that far from the train station and it is IN Venice, not in Mestre (spl?) or on the Lido, and it is right on the Grand Canal, so that it is a wonderful aspect. Some rooms are facing the Grand Canal, our room definitely did not. The hotel itself is okay, the lighting is below average, and the decoration in our room was very plain. But since I spent so little time in the room, except to sleep and shower, it was not that big of a deal. I don't know the room price since I didn't pay for it separately, but unless it is quite inexpensive, I don't think I would stay there again. I would look around for another hotel with perhaps a little bit more charm, but if it was the only place that I could afford, I wouldn't be opposed to it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Continental Venice
HotelInfo.Address: Lista di Spagna | Cannaregio 166, 30100 Venice, Italy
